bug.author: kurt-rhee
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
My application is running forever and also freezes up and down scrolling. The cmd window displays Discarding ScriptRequest.RERUN request after shutdown and other errors. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33131958/91091546-95c58500-e60b-11ea-9ee3-5475d63636f0.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug: Interact with file_uploader <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
File_uploader would upload files <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Explain the buggy behavior you experience when you go through the steps above. If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Yes, no change in code, now there is an error. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.65.2 Python version: 3.6.9 Using Conda OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Chrome
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
N/A

comments.comment: I have also noticed that a similar app that uses the same virtual environment runs fine, but in this case I am uploading a kml file instead of a txt file, perhaps that has something to do with it? As for the Matplotlib error, I removed and reinstalled matplotlib and that particular warning message has gone away.
Turns out my user was just uploading the wrong file. No issues here.
